name: 林文印
objective: 永續發展是妥善規劃與管理自然資源之最高指導原則，因此本課程依此宗旨討論土壤管理、有害物質處理與處置、水及廢水處理與管理；更將以實際例將面向擴及科技與社經整合層次，以期落實理論於實際應用之中。
schedule:
1 Introduction
2 Characteristics of Environmental Problems
3 Sustainable Development
4 Energy and Environment
5 Green Community
6 Oral Presentations
scorePolicy:
1. Class Participation 20%
2. Homework 40%
3. Term Paper & Presentation 40%

name: 胡憲倫
objective:
Students will be guided from a broader and global perspective to learn the social and humanity aspects of protecting the Earth. Lectures will cover systems thinking and its importance to Sustainable Development, Innovation and emerging technologies for sustainability, Natural Capitalism and its strategies, and Circular Economy.
學生將會學習從較宏觀的視野來認識屬於人文與社會層面的環境管理。課程將會透過系統思考及永續創新的角度，來反思地球的現在與未來；闡述新經濟時代的來臨與綠色資本主義的重要性及其四種策略，來緩解氣候變遷及全球暖化的趨勢，創造企業競爭優勢，並開創人類永續發展的新契機。
schedule:
Week 1 導論-資本主義與永續發展(綠色資本主義/永續發展目標)
Introduction- Capitalism and Sustainable Development/Natural Capitalism and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
Week 2 生物模擬－師法自然
Learning from the Nature- Biomimicry (Lecture by Ms. Suphichaya Suppipat) 
Week 3 永續創新及提昇資源生產力(Sustainable Innovation, Resource Productivity)
Week 4 服務與流動的經濟(產品服務系統)
Product Service System (PSS)& Circular Economy
Week 5 金字塔底層及包容性經濟Bottom of the Pyramid (BOP) & Inclusive Business
Week 6 結語及分組報告(Conclusion and Group Presentation)
materials:
1.　　Sachs, J.D. The Age of Sustainable Development, The Wylie Agency (UK), 2015 (周曉琪、羅耀宗譯，永續發展新紀元，天下文化，2017) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EadvEChBNUA
2.　　Lovins, A.B. Lovins, L.H. and P. Hawken, A Roadmap for Natural Capitalism, Harvard Business Review, May-June, 145-158, 1999
3.　　Senge et al., The Necessary Revolution- How Individuals and Organizations are Working Together to Create a Sustainable World, The Doubleday Publishing Group, 2008 (齊若蘭譯，Peter Senge原著，必要的革命-個人與組織如何共創永續社會，天下文化，2010)
4.　　Papers assigned for the class

name: 曾昭衡

This is intented as a brief introduction to the subject of the substainable development of natural resource. Main subject are soil management, hazardous waste treatment and disposal and water and wastewater treatment and management. Many overall regional case studies will be discussed. It must be technologic, economic and social environmental change or a new factural data are developed
